resources.string: In short: Our policy is not to gather data. All the recorded sensor / GPS data are stored only locally for you. We get only technical reports, which are used to fix bugs in the SensorBox. For further details, you can read our policy at website.

Main purpose of SensorBox is to record all outputs to csv files. For full functionality, the SensorBox needs 3 permissions:

 • Storage - to store all csv files recorded by you

 • Location - to capture your coordinates, the app need you to provide us unlimited access to GPS at background

 • Physical Activity - to capture your changes in state - walking, driving, … - check Activity recognition API in settings

 • Body Sensors - to record heart rate on Wear Os device, if available

Any of your recorded data are not shared with us. They are stored only locally in your phone. Recording is started only by you. For more information, you can read our Privacy Policy in "About" tab.
SensorBox will not be fully functional without permissions. If you need to change permissions, visit settings of the app.

To store csv files, the app requires storage permission to access memory.\n\nIf you picked \"Do not ask again\" or picked denied multiple times, you will be moved to settings to change the permission.
To store csv files, the app requires storage permission to access memory

In order to get heart rate values and save them to csv file, the heart rate sensor requires \"Body sensors\". \n\nIf you picked \"Do not ask again\" or picked denied multiple times, you will be moved to settings to change the permission.
To use heart rate - Body sensors permission is required
To save sensor data, give SensorBox permission to storage in settings
To show your location, the permission for location access is required

In order to save GPS coordinates on your phone in form of csv, location services have to be enabled in the background. 
List of features with usage of location:

 • Save coordinates to csv file

 • Show your current location on map (only in foreground)

 The location is accessed in the background only during the measurement, while the notification is visible. Therefore, you have to give permissions to use mentioned features. 

If you picked "Do not ask again" or picked denied multiple times, you will be moved to settings to change the permission.

In order to save GPS coordinates on your phone in form of csv, location services have to be enabled in the background. 
List of features with usage of location:

 • Save coordinates to csv file

 • Show your current location on map (only in foreground)

 The location is accessed in the background only during the measurement, while the notification is visible. Therefore, you have to give permissions to use mentioned features.

 You will be moved to settings, where you have to give unlimited access to location to the app. Unfortunately, Android 10 and higher stops GPS updates, after certain period of time due to the battery restrictions. Otherwise, the GPS recording would be redundant.

To log movement recognition changes to csv files, the app requires permission for this kind of recognition.\n\nIf you picked \"Do not ask again\" or picked denied multiple times, you will be moved to settings to change the permission.

Every CSV file is composed of header, where you can find time as "t", values of specific sensor and accuracy of the sensor as "a".

Timestamps across sensors and activity transitions are in nanoseconds of Android system time. GPS, periodic activity recognition, significant motion and other use UNIX time.

To convert sensor timestamps to UNIX time follow these steps:

 • subtract from column nanos field from "extra.json" - this is starting time of measurement in Android system time

 • convert nanoseconds to milliseconds

 • add to column millis from "extra.json" - this is starting time of measurement in UNIX time

Accuracy is in range from 0 to 3, where 0 means the lowest accuracy and 3 the highest.

Wear Os has aggressive battery saving routines, which prohibit to record sensors for longer period of time. You can try it without any additional options, but the measurement will not provide longer measurements, then 2 mins in general. 

Solutions: 
• use wake lock, but usually it does not to lead to reasonable solution
• turn on always on display and leave the screen on red measurement screen of the watch. The screen will become black after 1 min, but is still reactive as it would not be asleep. This should be enough to keep the device alive and data flow intact. However, it can increase battery drainage.

These options can be found in settings of the Wear Os app.
No optimisations required under Android M
The parameter is too high! Max:
Allow Activity recognition permission in settings to log changes in activity

SensorBox uses Activity Recognition Client, Google's API, which is native tool for activity recognition for Android. The client is capable to provide basic information about movement status of a phone, whether it is in a vehicle, with a person or stationary placed. 

The client can recognize changes among these activities:

 • In vehicle - 0
 • On Bicycle - 1
 • On foot - running/walking - 2
 • Still - device is not moving - 3
 • Walking - 7
 • Running - 8

These data will be stored in "activity_changes.csv" with a appropriate timestamp in NANOseconds of system time. Numbers beside the activities are used to encode them in csv file. Last column "enter_exit" describes, if the activity was entered (0) or exited (1).

With the customizable frequency of updates, you can get an actual confidence of each activity in %. This data will be stored in "activity_confidence.csv" with timestamps in MILLIseconds - UNIX time. There are also available this activities:

 • Tilting - device angle relative to gravity changed significantly - 5
 • Unknown - unable to detect activity - 4

Sum of activities do not equal to 100%, because some activities are not exclusive (on foot is generalization of walking and running). Moreover, the frequency of updates do not need to be precise, due to a battery optimizations of system.
Add custom notes to JSON file
Add custom noise alarms during measurement
Only letters and underscores are permitted.
The application that can record sensors and GPS to CSV files, which is also compatible with Wear Os
All the measured data are stored locally. None of them are sent to any cloud. Moreover, this is open-source project. Visit our github!
We gather only error messages, which can be used to fix the app. By moving on, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms.
In order to save files or use activity recognition, GPS, we need you to give the app permissions.

Due to the Android power saving routines, the app does not need to work properly. For example after the screen turns off, sensors can too or app gets killed by the system. Some routines are from manufacturer itself.

To turn off Android power management, click on button above. However, manufacturer side does not have method to turn off. Usually, the way to switch it off is to go to settings -> battery -> and add app to whitelist. Even this does not guarantee proper functionality.

To turn off Android power management, click on button on left. However, manufacturer side does not have method to turn off. Usually, the way to switch it off is to go to settings -> battery -> and add app to whitelist. Even this does not guarantee proper functionality.
Device does not support this option
Here you can pick folder, where to store all the files. Picked folder is:\n\n%s
SensorBox folder will be created in your root directory.
Please visit settings to give permissions to the app
The permission are required for full functionality
Please pick folder, where to store all the measurements

SensorBox serves as sensor output aggregation tool. You can pick sensors, views their parameters, store them in csv files. During measurement, you can set up alarms, write notes and take annotations. Application is compatible with Wear Os. SensorBox is open source project, so you can visit github page for code.
Synchronization is not available - restart connection
Turn off Wear Os active measurement

In order to get heart rate values and save them to csv file, the heart rate sensor requires \"Body sensors\" permission for Wear Os. The permission will be shown at your smartwatch after clicking the button.
Turn off Wear Os active measurement
